meanings.definition: The act of preserving a dead body by embalming and drying it to prevent decay.
meanings.sent1: The mummifications of ancient pharaohs involved intricate rituals and careful preservation techniques.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists study mummifications to learn about ancient burial practices.
meanings.sent3: During the mummifications, the embalmers accidentally spilled some preservatives, causing a sticky situation.
meanings.sent4: The mummifications of history hold secrets of the past tightly wrapped in bandages.
meanings.sent5: The mummifications of the Egyptian civilization are a fascinating glimpse into their beliefs about the afterlife.
